subject: Biology
overview: ATCT style Class 10 Biology syllabus for detailed study.

topics.brief: Process by which organisms obtain and use food for energy, growth and repair.

subtopics.name: Autotrophic Nutrition
subtopics.explanation: Organisms (plants) make their own food via photosynthesis using CO2, water and sunlight.

subtopics.name: Heterotrophic Nutrition
subtopics.explanation: Organisms obtain food from other organisms (animals, fungi, many bacteria).

topics.brief: Conversion of light energy into chemical energy in plants (glucose) taking place in chloroplasts.

subtopics.name: Equation
subtopics.explanation: 6CO2 + 6H2O + light ‚Üí C6H12O6 + 6O2 (simplified overall reaction).

subtopics.name: Factors affecting photosynthesis
subtopics.explanation: Light intensity, CO2 concentration, temperature and chlorophyll availability.

topics.brief: Ingestion ‚Üí Digestion ‚Üí Absorption ‚Üí Assimilation ‚Üí Egestion in the human alimentary canal.

subtopics.name: Alimentary canal parts
subtopics.explanation: Mouth, oesophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine, rectum, anus.

subtopics.name: Functions
subtopics.explanation: Mechanical breakdown, chemical digestion (enzymes), absorption (villi) and egestion.

topics.brief: Biological catalysts that break down complex food into absorbable units.

subtopics.name: Salivary amylase
subtopics.explanation: Starts starch digestion into maltose in mouth.

subtopics.name: Pepsin and trypsin
subtopics.explanation: Pepsin in stomach breaks proteins; trypsin in small intestine continues protein digestion.

subtopics.name: Lipase
subtopics.explanation: Breaks fats into fatty acids and glycerol in small intestine.

topics.brief: Small intestine structures that increase surface area for nutrient absorption.

subtopics.name: Villus structure
subtopics.explanation: Microvilli, capillaries and lacteal for absorption of glucose/amino acids and fats respectively.

topics.brief: Movement of water, minerals and food through xylem and phloem.

subtopics.name: Xylem
subtopics.explanation: Transports water and dissolved minerals upwards from roots to shoots (transpiration pull).

subtopics.name: Phloem
subtopics.explanation: Translocation of sugars from sources to sinks through sieve tubes and companion cells.

topics.brief: Loss of water vapour from aerial parts of plants, mainly through stomata.

subtopics.name: Purpose
subtopics.explanation: Helps in upward water movement, cooling and mineral transport.

subtopics.name: Factors
subtopics.explanation: Temperature, humidity, wind, light intensity and stomatal opening.

topics.brief: Guard cell mechanism controlling gas exchange and transpiration.

subtopics.name: Guard cells
subtopics.explanation: Change shape by turgor pressure (K+ uptake) to open/close stomata.

topics.brief: Process of breaking down glucose to release energy (ATP).

subtopics.name: Aerobic respiration
subtopics.explanation: Requires oxygen; produces CO2, water and large amount of ATP.

subtopics.name: Anaerobic respiration
subtopics.explanation: Without oxygen; produces lactic acid in animals or alcohol + CO2 in yeast with less ATP.

topics.brief: Organs involved in breathing and gas exchange: nostrils, trachea, bronchi, lungs, alveoli.

subtopics.name: Alveoli
subtopics.explanation: Site of gas exchange; thin walls, large surface area and rich blood supply.

subtopics.name: Mechanism of breathing
subtopics.explanation: Inspiration: diaphragm contracts, thoracic volume increases; Expiration: diaphragm relaxes.

topics.brief: Diffusion of O2 into blood and CO2 out of blood at alveoli and tissues.

subtopics.name: Partial pressure gradient
subtopics.explanation: Drives diffusion of gases (high to low concentration).

topics.brief: Transport of gases, nutrients and wastes via heart, blood and blood vessels.

subtopics.name: Double circulation
subtopics.explanation: Pulmonary (heart-lungs) and systemic (heart-body) circuits in humans.

subtopics.name: Blood components
subtopics.explanation: RBCs, WBCs, platelets and plasma with functions (oxygen transport, immunity, clotting).

topics.brief: Four-chambered heart that pumps blood; atria receive, ventricles pump.

subtopics.name: Valves
subtopics.explanation: Prevent backflow (atrioventricular and semilunar valves).

subtopics.name: Cardiac cycle
subtopics.explanation: Sequence of contraction (systole) and relaxation (diastole).

topics.brief: Arteries, veins and capillaries ‚Äî structure suits function.

subtopics.name: Capillaries
subtopics.explanation: Thin walls for exchange between blood and tissues.

subtopics.name: Veins
subtopics.explanation: Have valves to prevent backflow; carry blood to heart.

topics.brief: Removal of metabolic nitrogenous wastes primarily by kidneys.

subtopics.name: Kidney function
subtopics.explanation: Filters blood, forms urine, maintains water-salt balance and removes urea.

subtopics.name: Urine formation steps
subtopics.explanation: Filtration, reabsorption and secretion in nephron.

topics.brief: Structural and functional unit of kidney; includes glomerulus and tubules.

subtopics.name: Glomerulus
subtopics.explanation: Site of plasma filtration under pressure.

subtopics.name: Loop of Henle
subtopics.explanation: Important for concentrating urine (water reabsorption).

topics.brief: Maintenance of stable internal conditions (temperature, pH, water balance).

subtopics.name: Thermoregulation
subtopics.explanation: Sweating, vasodilation/vasoconstriction, shivering help maintain temperature.

subtopics.name: Osmoregulation
subtopics.explanation: Kidneys regulate water and solute levels to maintain osmotic balance.

topics.brief: Role of microbes in digestion, fermentation and decomposition.

subtopics.name: Ruminants
subtopics.explanation: Microbes in stomach chambers (e.g., cattle) digest cellulose.

subtopics.name: Yeast fermentation
subtopics.explanation: Anaerobic breakdown of sugars producing alcohol and CO2.

topics.brief: Unicellular heterotroph; ingestion by phagocytosis forming food vacuoles.

subtopics.name: Phagocytosis
subtopics.explanation: Cell membrane engulfs food particles; digestion occurs in vacuoles.

topics.brief: Essential minerals (N, P, K, Mg, Fe) for growth and chlorophyll formation.

subtopics.name: Deficiency symptoms
subtopics.explanation: Chlorosis, stunted growth, necrosis depending on missing nutrient.

topics.brief: Parasitic, saprophytic and symbiotic nutrition examples.

subtopics.name: Parasitic plants
subtopics.explanation: Obtain nutrients from host (e.g., Cuscuta).

subtopics.name: Saprophytes
subtopics.explanation: Obtain nutrients from dead organic matter (fungi).

topics.brief: Different adaptations: crop, gizzard, typhlosole etc.

subtopics.name: Earthworm digestion
subtopics.explanation: Soil ingestion, digestion in gut with typhlosole to increase surface area.

subtopics.name: Insect gut
subtopics.explanation: Foregut, midgut, hindgut with specialized regions for storage and grinding.

topics.brief: ATP as cellular energy currency produced in respiration.

subtopics.name: ATP role
subtopics.explanation: Drives metabolic reactions, muscle contraction and active transport.

subtopics.name: Glycolysis (basic)
subtopics.explanation: Glucose ‚Üí pyruvate in cytoplasm producing small ATP; first step of respiration.

topics.brief: Important short/long answer points often asked in exams.

subtopics.name: Describe photosynthesis
subtopics.explanation: State equation, site (chloroplast), raw materials, importance and factors.

subtopics.name: Explain human digestion
subtopics.explanation: Write steps for any one enzyme action + role of small intestine and villi.

topics.brief: Nervous and endocrine systems work together to detect changes, process information and respond appropriately.

subtopics.name: Stimulus and Response
subtopics.explanation: Stimulus: any change in environment; Response: organism's reaction to stimulus.

subtopics.name: Importance
subtopics.explanation: Helps organisms survive, maintain homeostasis and interact with environment.

topics.brief: Comprises brain, spinal cord and nerves; made of neurons.

subtopics.name: Neuron structure
subtopics.explanation: Cell body, dendrites (receive signals), axon (transmits signals), synapse (junction).

subtopics.name: Types of neurons
subtopics.explanation: Sensory (afferent), motor (efferent), relay (interneurons).

topics.brief: Electrical and chemical signals that allow communication between neurons.

subtopics.name: Electrical impulse
subtopics.explanation: Travels along axon membrane due to movement of ions (Na+, K+).

subtopics.name: Synaptic transmission
subtopics.explanation: Neurotransmitters cross synapse to pass signal to next neuron.

topics.brief: Control center of body; protected by skull and meninges.

subtopics.name: Forebrain
subtopics.explanation: Cerebrum (thinking, memory), thalamus (relay), hypothalamus (homeostasis).

subtopics.name: Midbrain
subtopics.explanation: Controls visual and auditory reflexes.

subtopics.name: Hindbrain
subtopics.explanation: Cerebellum (balance, coordination), medulla (vital functions).

topics.brief: Long tubular structure extending from brain; reflex actions and signal conduction.

subtopics.name: Structure
subtopics.explanation: Protected by vertebral column; grey and white matter inside.

subtopics.name: Functions
subtopics.explanation: Conducts signals between brain and body; reflex center.

topics.brief: Automatic, rapid, involuntary response to stimulus.

subtopics.name: Reflex arc
subtopics.explanation: Pathway: receptor ‚Üí sensory neuron ‚Üí spinal cord ‚Üí motor neuron ‚Üí effector.

subtopics.name: Examples
subtopics.explanation: Knee jerk, pulling hand from hot object.

topics.brief: Difference between conscious and automatic actions.

subtopics.name: Voluntary actions
subtopics.explanation: Under conscious control (e.g., writing, speaking).

subtopics.name: Involuntary actions
subtopics.explanation: Automatic (e.g., heartbeat, digestion, reflexes).

topics.brief: Nerves connecting CNS to rest of body.

subtopics.name: Cranial nerves
subtopics.explanation: From brain to head/neck regions.

subtopics.name: Spinal nerves
subtopics.explanation: From spinal cord to body parts.

topics.brief: Controls involuntary functions; sympathetic and parasympathetic.

subtopics.name: Sympathetic
subtopics.explanation: Fight or flight response (increases heart rate).

subtopics.name: Parasympathetic
subtopics.explanation: Rest and digest (calms body).

topics.brief: Chemical coordination via hormones secreted by glands.

subtopics.name: Hormones
subtopics.explanation: Chemical messengers secreted directly into blood; slow, long-lasting effects.

subtopics.name: Glands
subtopics.explanation: Endocrine (ductless) vs exocrine (with ducts).

topics.brief: Master gland at base of brain; controls other endocrine glands.

subtopics.name: Functions
subtopics.explanation: Secretes growth hormone, TSH, ACTH, FSH, LH etc.

topics.brief: Glands in neck region regulating metabolism and calcium.

subtopics.name: Thyroid hormones
subtopics.explanation: Thyroxine (metabolism), calcitonin (calcium).

subtopics.name: Parathyroid hormone
subtopics.explanation: Increases blood calcium level.

topics.brief: On top of kidneys; emergency hormones.

subtopics.name: Adrenaline
subtopics.explanation: Fight or flight hormone; increases heart rate, blood pressure.

topics.brief: Both endocrine and exocrine functions.

subtopics.name: Islets of Langerhans
subtopics.explanation: Alpha cells (glucagon), beta cells (insulin) - regulate blood sugar.

topics.brief: Testes and ovaries producing sex hormones.

subtopics.name: Testosterone
subtopics.explanation: Male secondary sexual characteristics.

subtopics.name: Estrogen, progesterone
subtopics.explanation: Female secondary sexual characteristics and menstrual cycle.

topics.brief: Regulation of hormone secretion.

subtopics.name: Negative feedback
subtopics.explanation: High hormone level inhibits further secretion (e.g., insulin).

topics.brief: Differences between two coordination systems.

subtopics.name: Speed
subtopics.explanation: Nervous: fast; Endocrine: slow.

subtopics.name: Duration
subtopics.explanation: Nervous: short-lived; Endocrine: long-lasting.

topics.brief: Plants also show control and coordination through movements.

subtopics.name: Tropic movements
subtopics.explanation: Directional growth responses (phototropism, geotropism).

subtopics.name: Nastic movements
subtopics.explanation: Non-directional (thigmonasty, photonasty).

topics.brief: Chemicals regulating plant growth and development.

subtopics.name: Auxins
subtopics.explanation: Cell elongation, phototropism, apical dominance.

subtopics.name: Gibberellins
subtopics.explanation: Stem elongation, seed germination.

subtopics.name: Cytokinins
subtopics.explanation: Cell division, delay aging.

subtopics.name: Abscisic acid (ABA)
subtopics.explanation: Stress hormone, promotes dormancy, stomatal closure.

subtopics.name: Ethylene
subtopics.explanation: Fruit ripening, leaf abscission.

topics.brief: Growth towards/away from light and gravity.

subtopics.name: Phototropism mechanism
subtopics.explanation: Auxin distribution causes unequal growth - bends towards light.

subtopics.name: Geotropism
subtopics.explanation: Roots positive, shoots negative to gravity.

topics.brief: How phytohormones help plants respond to environment.

subtopics.name: Defense responses
subtopics.explanation: Production of chemicals against herbivores/pathogens.

topics.brief: Key differences with examples.

subtopics.name: Directionality
subtopics.explanation: Tropic: directional; Nastic: non-directional.

subtopics.name: Examples
subtopics.explanation: Tropic: sunflower to sun; Nastic: touch-me-not leaf folding.

topics.brief: Nervous and endocrine system related diseases.

subtopics.name: Goiter
subtopics.explanation: Thyroid enlargement due to iodine deficiency.

subtopics.name: Diabetes
subtopics.explanation: High blood sugar due to insulin deficiency/resistance.

topics.brief: Specialized structures detecting stimuli.

subtopics.name: Photoreceptors
subtopics.explanation: Eyes - detect light.

subtopics.name: Phonoreceptors
subtopics.explanation: Ears - detect sound.

subtopics.name: Olfactory receptors
subtopics.explanation: Nose - detect smell.

subtopics.name: Gustatory receptors
subtopics.explanation: Tongue - detect taste.

subtopics.name: Thermoreceptors
subtopics.explanation: Skin - detect temperature.

topics.brief: Important short/long answer points often asked in exams.

subtopics.name: Reflex arc diagram and explanation
subtopics.explanation: Draw and label reflex arc; explain pathway with example.

subtopics.name: Compare nervous and endocrine systems
subtopics.explanation: Give differences in tabular form.

subtopics.name: Plant hormones and functions
subtopics.explanation: List 5 phytohormones with one function each.

topics.brief: Biological process by which new individuals of the same species are produced, ensuring continuity of life.

subtopics.name: Importance of Reproduction
subtopics.explanation: Maintains species existence, creates variations for evolution, and transfers genetic material to next generation.

subtopics.name: Basic Characteristics
subtopics.explanation: DNA copying, cell division, and formation of new organisms with similar traits.

topics.brief: Two main types: asexual (single parent) and sexual (two parents).

subtopics.name: Asexual Reproduction
subtopics.explanation: Single parent, no gametes, offspring genetically identical (clones), faster process.

subtopics.name: Sexual Reproduction
subtopics.explanation: Two parents, gamete formation, fertilization, genetic variations, evolutionarily advantageous.

subtopics.name: Comparison Table
subtopics.explanation: Asexual: simple, rapid, no variations; Sexual: complex, slow, genetic diversity.

topics.brief: Various ways organisms reproduce asexually without gamete formation.

subtopics.name: Binary Fission
subtopics.explanation: Parent cell divides into two equal daughters (Amoeba, bacteria).

subtopics.name: Multiple Fission
subtopics.explanation: Parent divides into many daughters (Plasmodium during malaria).

subtopics.name: Budding
subtopics.explanation: Outgrowth forms and detaches (Hydra, yeast).

subtopics.name: Fragmentation
subtopics.explanation: Body breaks into pieces, each grows into new organism (Spirogyra, fungi).

subtopics.name: Regeneration
subtopics.explanation: Ability to regrow lost parts (Planaria, starfish).

subtopics.name: Spore Formation
subtopics.explanation: Specialized cells (spores) develop into new individuals (Rhizopus, ferns).

subtopics.name: Vegetative Propagation
subtopics.explanation: New plants from vegetative parts (roots, stems, leaves).

topics.brief: Simple cell division in unicellular organisms.

subtopics.name: Process in Amoeba
subtopics.explanation: Pseudopodia withdrawn ‚Üí nucleus divides ‚Üí cytoplasm divides ‚Üí two daughters formed.

subtopics.name: Process in Paramecium
subtopics.explanation: Transverse binary fission, micronucleus and macronucleus divide.

subtopics.name: Significance
subtopics.explanation: Rapid multiplication under favorable conditions.

topics.brief: Formation of buds that develop into new organisms.

subtopics.name: Hydra Budding
subtopics.explanation: Outgrowth forms on body wall ‚Üí develops mouth, tentacles ‚Üí detaches as independent individual.

subtopics.name: Yeast Budding
subtopics.explanation: Small protrusion forms on parent cell ‚Üí nucleus divides ‚Üí one nucleus migrates to bud ‚Üí separates.

topics.brief: Reproduction through microscopic spores in fungi.

subtopics.name: Structure of Rhizopus
subtopics.explanation: Mycelium, hyphae, sporangium, sporangiophore, spores.

subtopics.name: Process
subtopics.explanation: Sporangium develops at tips ‚Üí nuclei + cytoplasm form spores ‚Üí sporangium bursts ‚Üí spores disperse ‚Üí germinate in moist conditions.

subtopics.name: Advantages
subtopics.explanation: Mass production, easy dispersal, survival in unfavorable conditions.

topics.brief: Asexual reproduction using vegetative plant parts.

subtopics.name: Natural Methods
subtopics.explanation: Tubers (potato), bulbs (onion), rhizomes (ginger), runners (grass).

subtopics.name: Artificial Methods
subtopics.explanation: Cutting, grafting, layering, tissue culture.

subtopics.name: Advantages
subtopics.explanation: Faster than seeds, preserves desired traits, seedless varieties.

subtopics.name: Disadvantages
subtopics.explanation: No genetic variation, disease accumulation.

topics.brief: Modern artificial vegetative propagation technique.

subtopics.name: Process
subtopics.explanation: Small tissue (explant) ‚Üí sterile nutrient medium ‚Üí cell division ‚Üí plantlets ‚Üí mature plants.

subtopics.name: Applications
subtopics.explanation: Mass propagation of elite plants, disease-free plants, conservation of rare species.

topics.brief: Involves flower structure, gamete formation, and fertilization.

subtopics.name: Flower Structure
subtopics.explanation: Four whorls: calyx (sepals), corolla (petals), androecium (male), gynoecium (female).

subtopics.name: Essential vs Non-essential Parts
subtopics.explanation: Essential: androecium and gynoecium; Non-essential: sepals and petals.

subtopics.name: Bisexual vs Unisexual Flowers
subtopics.explanation: Bisexual: both sexes; Unisexual: only male or female flowers.

topics.brief: Stamen structure and function in flower.

subtopics.name: Stamen Parts
subtopics.explanation: Anther (pollen production) and filament (support).

subtopics.name: Pollen Grains
subtopics.explanation: Male gametes, contain sperm cells, produced in anther lobes.

topics.brief: Carpel/pistil structure and function.

subtopics.name: Carpel Parts
subtopics.explanation: Stigma (pollen reception), style (tube), ovary (ovules).

subtopics.name: Ovule Structure
subtopics.explanation: Contains embryo sac with egg cell, integuments, micropyle.

topics.brief: Transfer of pollen from anther to stigma.

subtopics.name: Self-pollination
subtopics.explanation: Within same flower or different flowers of same plant.

subtopics.name: Cross-pollination
subtopics.explanation: Between flowers of different plants of same species.

subtopics.name: Agents of Pollination
subtopics.explanation: Wind, water, insects, birds, animals.

topics.brief: Fusion of male and female gametes to form zygote.

subtopics.name: Process
subtopics.explanation: Pollen on stigma ‚Üí pollen tube growth through style ‚Üí sperm nuclei reach ovule ‚Üí double fertilization.

subtopics.name: Double Fertilization
subtopics.explanation: One sperm + egg = zygote; Other sperm + polar nuclei = endosperm (unique to angiosperms).

topics.brief: Development of seed and fruit after fertilization.

subtopics.name: Seed Formation
subtopics.explanation: Ovule develops into seed containing embryo (plumule, radicle, cotyledons).

subtopics.name: Fruit Formation
subtopics.explanation: Ovary develops into fruit, pericarp layers (epicarp, mesocarp, endocarp).

subtopics.name: Seed Dispersal
subtopics.explanation: Wind, water, animals, explosion mechanisms.

topics.brief: Process by which seed develops into seedling.

subtopics.name: Conditions Required
subtopics.explanation: Water, oxygen, suitable temperature.

subtopics.name: Types of Germination
subtopics.explanation: Epigeal (cotyledons above ground) and Hypogeal (cotyledons below ground).

topics.brief: Organs involved in production and delivery of male gametes.

subtopics.name: Testes
subtopics.explanation: Primary sex organs, produce sperm and testosterone, located in scrotum.

subtopics.name: Epididymis
subtopics.explanation: Coiled tube where sperm mature and are stored.

subtopics.name: Vas Deferens
subtopics.explanation: Tube carrying sperm from epididymis to urethra.

subtopics.name: Accessory Glands
subtopics.explanation: Seminal vesicles, prostate gland, bulbourethral gland - produce seminal fluid.

subtopics.name: Penis
subtopics.explanation: Copulatory organ, delivers sperm into female reproductive tract.

topics.brief: Male gamete specialized for movement and fertilization.

subtopics.name: Parts of Sperm
subtopics.explanation: Head (nucleus, acrosome), middle piece (mitochondria), tail (flagellum for movement).

subtopics.name: Spermatogenesis
subtopics.explanation: Process of sperm production in seminiferous tubules of testes.

topics.brief: Organs involved in egg production, fertilization, and embryo development.

subtopics.name: Ovaries
subtopics.explanation: Primary sex organs, produce eggs and estrogen/progesterone.

subtopics.name: Fallopian Tubes
subtopics.explanation: Oviducts, site of fertilization, transport egg to uterus.

subtopics.name: Uterus
subtopics.explanation: Womb, site of embryo development, muscular organ.

subtopics.name: Cervix
subtopics.explanation: Lower part of uterus opening into vagina.

subtopics.name: Vagina
subtopics.explanation: Birth canal, receives sperm during intercourse.

topics.brief: Female gamete and its production process.

subtopics.name: Structure of Ovum
subtopics.explanation: Large, non-motile, contains yolk, surrounded by zona pellucida and corona radiata.

subtopics.name: Oogenesis
subtopics.explanation: Egg formation process in ovaries, begins before birth, completes after puberty.

topics.brief: Monthly reproductive cycle in human females.

subtopics.name: Phases
subtopics.explanation: Menstrual (days 1-5), Follicular (days 6-13), Ovulatory (day 14), Luteal (days 15-28).

subtopics.name: Hormonal Control
subtopics.explanation: FSH, LH, estrogen, progesterone regulate cycle events.

subtopics.name: Ovulation
subtopics.explanation: Release of mature egg from ovary around day 14.

topics.brief: Process of sperm-egg fusion leading to zygote formation.

subtopics.name: Process
subtopics.explanation: Sperm penetration ‚Üí acrosomal reaction ‚Üí cortical reaction ‚Üí fusion of nuclei ‚Üí zygote formation.

subtopics.name: Site of Fertilization
subtopics.explanation: Ampulla of fallopian tube.

subtopics.name: Twins Formation
subtopics.explanation: Identical (one zygote splits) and Fraternal (two eggs fertilized).

topics.brief: Attachment of embryo to uterus and subsequent development.

subtopics.name: Implantation
subtopics.explanation: Blastocyst attaches to uterine wall 6-7 days after fertilization.

subtopics.name: Placenta Formation
subtopics.explanation: Organ connecting mother and embryo for nutrient/waste exchange.

subtopics.name: Gestation Period
subtopics.explanation: Approximately 280 days (40 weeks) in humans.

topics.brief: Stages of development from zygote to fetus.

subtopics.name: Cleavage
subtopics.explanation: Rapid cell divisions forming morula then blastocyst.

subtopics.name: Gastrulation
subtopics.explanation: Formation of three germ layers: ectoderm, mesoderm, endoderm.

subtopics.name: Organogenesis
subtopics.explanation: Development of organs from germ layers.

topics.brief: Maintaining healthy reproductive system and preventing diseases.

subtopics.name: STDs/STIs
subtopics.explanation: Sexually transmitted diseases/infections - HIV/AIDS, syphilis, gonorrhea, herpes.

subtopics.name: Birth Control Methods
subtopics.explanation: Natural, barrier, hormonal, surgical methods of contraception.

subtopics.name: Importance of Hygiene
subtopics.explanation: Personal cleanliness to prevent infections.

topics.brief: Various ways to prevent pregnancy.

subtopics.name: Barrier Methods
subtopics.explanation: Condoms, diaphragms - prevent sperm reaching egg.

subtopics.name: Hormonal Methods
subtopics.explanation: Pills, implants - prevent ovulation.

subtopics.name: IUDs
subtopics.explanation: Intrauterine devices - prevent implantation.

subtopics.name: Surgical Methods
subtopics.explanation: Vasectomy (male), Tubectomy (female) - permanent sterilization.

topics.brief: Various reproductive strategies in animal kingdom.

subtopics.name: External Fertilization
subtopics.explanation: In water, many gametes released (fish, amphibians).

subtopics.name: Internal Fertilization
subtopics.explanation: Inside female body, fewer gametes (reptiles, birds, mammals).

subtopics.name: Oviparous Animals
subtopics.explanation: Lay eggs, embryonic development outside (birds, reptiles).

subtopics.name: Viviparous Animals
subtopics.explanation: Give birth to young ones, embryonic development inside (mammals).

subtopics.name: Ovoviviparous Animals
subtopics.explanation: Eggs hatch inside body, then birth (some sharks, snakes).

topics.brief: Process of transformation from larva to adult.

subtopics.name: Complete Metamorphosis
subtopics.explanation: Egg ‚Üí larva ‚Üí pupa ‚Üí adult (butterflies, beetles).

subtopics.name: Incomplete Metamorphosis
subtopics.explanation: Egg ‚Üí nymph ‚Üí adult (cockroaches, grasshoppers).

topics.brief: Importance of DNA replication in reproduction.

subtopics.name: DNA Replication
subtopics.explanation: Process of making identical DNA copies before cell division.

subtopics.name: Importance of Variations
subtopics.explanation: Essential for evolution and species survival in changing environments.

subtopics.name: Sources of Variations
subtopics.explanation: Crossing over, mutations, random fertilization, independent assortment.

topics.brief: Cessation of menstrual cycles in females.

subtopics.name: Age of Onset
subtopics.explanation: Typically 45-55 years.

subtopics.name: Symptoms
subtopics.explanation: Hot flashes, mood changes, cessation of periods.

subtopics.name: Significance
subtopics.explanation: End of reproductive capacity in females.

topics.brief: Genetic mechanism deciding male or female offspring.

subtopics.name: Chromosomal Basis
subtopics.explanation: XX - female, XY - male; sperm determines sex of child.

subtopics.name: Role of SRY Gene
subtopics.explanation: On Y chromosome, triggers male development.

topics.brief: Health issues affecting reproductive systems.

subtopics.name: Infertility
subtopics.explanation: Inability to conceive, various causes in males and females.

subtopics.name: PCOS
subtopics.explanation: Polycystic ovarian syndrome - hormonal imbalance in females.

subtopics.name: Endometriosis
subtopics.explanation: Uterine tissue grows outside uterus causing pain.

topics.brief: Medical interventions to help conception.

subtopics.name: IVF
subtopics.explanation: In vitro fertilization - egg and sperm combined outside body.

subtopics.name: Artificial Insemination
